channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: President says Chicagoans are 'chanting bring in Trump' after violent downtown riot leaves 8 shot, 1 dead
item.description: Trump claims Chicagoans want federal help after a violent riot in the blue city's downtown left multiple officers injured and several children shot du...

item.title: American senators rip Trump's Ukraine peace proposal at international security conference in Canada
item.description: American senators panned a U.S. peace proposal on Ukraine at an international security conference Saturday, with one calling it one of the most seriou...

item.title: More than half of U.S. homes have dropped in value over the last year — and nearly all houses in these cities have seen losses
item.description: "Home values surged over the past six years, and the vast majority of homeowners still have significant equity. What we're seeing now is a normalizati...

item.title: 5 Questions About the U.S.-Russia Ukraine Peace Proposal
item.description: The Trump administration and the Kremlin crafted a 28-point peace plan for Ukraine without Ukraine's involvement.

item.title: Trump enlists Jack Nicklaus to help revamp the ‘president’s golf course’ — raising questions about who will pay the golf legend and how much
item.description: Nicklaus “will be the architect" and "design it,” Trump told reporters.

item.title: Republican and Democratic senators alike oppose Trump’s Ukraine peace plan that acquiesces to many Russian demands
item.description: The plan was crafted by the Trump administration and the Kremlin without Ukraine’s involvement.

item.title: Sen. Slotkin's home targeted with bomb threat days after she told troops to defy 'illegal' orders
item.description: Michigan State Police confirmed no one was in danger after Sen. Elissa Slotkin's home in Michigan received a bomb threat on Friday, a spokesperson sai...

item.title: Coast Guard revises policy on ‘a noose, a swastika, and any symbols or flags co-opted or adopted by hate-based groups’
item.description: Hours after the revelation that it would describe them as "potentially divisive," the Coast Guard made clear, these are "prohibited."

item.title: 'Marjorie went BAD': Trump keeps ripping MTG as she resigns
item.description: Trump did not hold back his criticism of Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene even after she announced her resignation from Congress.

item.title: Caesars Palace fined $7.8 million over Shohei Ohtani interpreter’s money laundering issues
item.description: The Nevada Gaming Control Board alleged that Caesars Palace failed to verify bookmaker Mathew Bowyer's source of funds as he gambled between 2017 and ...

item.title: Klimts Make YUGE Bucks at Sotheby’s, and Are Maine’s Aggrieved Penobscots Happy to Let a Masterpiece Rot?
item.description: Also in the news, Fabergé’s Winter Egg, with thousands of tiny diamonds, is set to sell at Christie’s.

item.title: Trump says 28-point peace plan to end Russia-Ukraine war isn't 'final offer'
item.description: President Trump said the U.S. peace plan to end the Russia-Ukraine war is not his final offer.

item.title: Newsom’s Prop 50 Could Be at Risk Thanks to Texas Judges
item.description: A federal court voted to block Texas’s redistricting. California conservatives should be pleased.

item.title: Halligan’s ‘Correction’ of the Record Sparks More Intrigue About Comey Indictment
item.description: Why did the DOJ create a second indictment document that makes it look like no charge was rejected?

item.title: Minneapolis police chief issues apology for linking Somali youth to local crime
item.description: Minneapolis police chief Brian O'Hara apologizes to Somali community after controversial comments linking "East African kids" to crime in recent inter...

item.title: Iran Drops the Façade of Tolerance Toward Persian Jews
item.description: Without consequences or outside pressure, the regime could revert to the same violent persecution that marked the early years of the Islamic Revolutio...

item.title: No, Ken Burns, the United States Is Not an Iroquois Nation
item.description: The Founders didn’t model us on the Six Nations, and George Washington didn’t tomahawk a Frenchman.

item.title: Trump pledge to 'immediately' end protections for Minnesota Somalis sparks fear and legal questions

item.title: California gubernatorial hopeful Eric Swalwell embraces role as Trump's loudest critic amid new DOJ probe
item.description: Outspoken Democrat Eric Swalwell of California calls the new DOJ investigation “political," saying he won’t back down from his clashes with Trump.

item.title: Reporter's Notebook : A 'letter' to Zelenskyy about the peace plan
item.description: Ukrainian contacts react negatively to Trump's 28-point peace plan for Ukraine, calling it heavily slanted toward Moscow as Zelenskyy reviews terms.

item.title: The Left Is Nowhere Near Letting Go Of Its Trans Obsession
item.description: The left's approach to defending transgenderism may fluctuate, but its loyalty is unshakeable.

item.title: Here’s Why Gavin Newsom’s Race-Based Gerrymandering In CA Will Fail
item.description: 'It’s pretty blatant that they were using race when they drew up new districts to get rid of Republicans,' said Hans von Spakovsky.

item.title: The Media’s Latest Push To Sink Comey Indictment Was Entirely Based On A Lie
item.description: 'Any assertion that the grand jury 'never voted on the two-count indictment' is contradicted by the official transcript,' a DOJ filing states.

item.title: Exclusive: Lawsuit Claims Leftist Benson Is Breaking Michigan Election Law
item.description: Secretary of State Jocelyn Benson's lax residency directive is 'unconstitutional and unlawful,' the RNC lawsuit alleges.

item.title: Documents: Letitia James Lied To Bank, Insurer In Alleged Mortgage Fraud Scheme
item.description: The timeline of James' claims suggest she knew her claims were false when she made them.
